page.title: 08WALNEY BIRD SANCTUARY
page.content: The Bird Sanctuary is located at the southern tip of Walney .It was started in 1963 by the Lancashire Naturalist Trust.Now it is owned by the Cumbria Trust.To keep the sanctuary open money is needed.The Trust get this from members subscriptions,donations from visitors and Government grants.It covers an area of about 1.5 miles and houses many different types of birds. The commonest to be recorded are the gulls like the herring gull and lesser black backed gull.Rare birds have often been recorded;the rarest of these are the{Padi-field Warbler}from Asia and the {White throated Sparrow} from the U.S.A.As well as gulls there are many types of plants.Rabbits and Moths are also common tthings to be seen-200 species of Moths and Butterflies. {P.T.O.
